dataset.title: R&D on the Extraction and Analysis Technologies of Plant Essential Oils (1/2)

creator.organizationName: Division of Forest Chemistry, Taiwan Forestry Research Institute.

abstract.para: Essential oils from plants are widely used in everyday items, such as food, cosmetics, fragrance agents, medicines, insecticides, antibacterial agents and aromatherapies etc. The applicable fields are widening along with the development of economic activities. Because essential oils are derived from various parts of plants, such as root, stem, leaves, flowers, fruit and wood, hence, different materials entail differing means of extraction. The extraction processes should include proper pretreatment of the plant materials collected from different locales. Then the moisture content shall be determined. Steam distillation method is often used to extract the essential oils and to determine its content. Afterward, gas chromatographic methods are used to analyze the compositions of the essential oils. These set the basis for the extraction, analysis and utilization of various essential oils. Finally the ways to utilize the waste distillation liquor and residual materials should be explored to minimize waste and maximize uses for the plant materials.

contact.organizationName: Division of Silviculture, Taiwan Forestry Research Institute

section.title: Sample collection
section.para: Collected the leaves and the barks of sample.

section.title: Identify materials
section.para: Identify materials with the morphological characters.

section.title: Extraction of essential oils.
section.para: The leaves and banks of the sampled trees were spread indoor with good ventilation to air dry. Then 150~200 g of the air-dried leaves were weighed and steam distillated for 6 h to extract leaf essential oils. To the collected essential oils, anhydrous sodium sulfate was added to remove residual moisture.

section.title: Analysis of essential oils.
section.para: The isolated leaf and bark essential oils were subjected to compositional analysis and identification. 1.Gas chromatograph (HP-5890-II, USA) was used for fractionation of individual components.

section.title: .Confirmation and comparison of contents
section.para: Gas chromatograph-mass spectroscopy (GC-MS,HP-6890,MSD) was used for component identification.
